attributes.action: change safety for wheelchairs on buses.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
At the moment, there are no restrictions in place to prevent wheelchairs moving when a bus stops, goes round a roundabout or goes up a hill. I feel that this needs to change and there needs to be either a lap seatbelt and a lap and diagonal seatbelt. This would not take up much room and make life safer for wheelchair users. 

A while ago, I contacted Hilary Armstrong about this issue who then contacted Jim Fitzpatrick, the minister for road safety at the time, but, unfortunately, I got a negative reply from him. So, that is why I tried putting my campaign up here. Let's see how far this gets me. 

When I went to Denmark a few years ago, I came across lap and diagonal seatbelts for wheelchair users on every bus. So, what I ask is, if Denmark can do it, why can't Britain?
